definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy

sentences.english: So the invasion from an enemy country irritated an Italian scientist.
sentences.chinese: 因此来自一个敌国的入侵激怒了一名意大利的科学家。

sentences.english: Rests in the ring, the rich can be the enemy, river's lake as the tomb of king.
sentences.chinese: 威名响四海，富甲可敌国，江湖称其为墓王派。

sentences.english: The conquerors depopulated the enemy's country by destruction and expulsion.
sentences.chinese: 征服者用毁灭和驱逐的方法来减少敌国的人口。

sentences.english: The soldiers marched towards the capital of the enemy country.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们向敌国的首都进军。

sentences.english: Second, be close with those he loves in order to fragment his awesomeness.
sentences.chinese: 二是拉拢敌君的近臣，以削弱敌国的力量。

sentences.english: Enemy states are no longer on the other side of the ocean, but just behind the firewall.
sentences.chinese: 敌国不在遥远的大洋彼岸，而就在防火墙之后。

sentences.english: How did a family that once owned so much find itself in such a corner?
sentences.chinese: 这样一个一度富可敌国的家族为何陷入如此绝境？

sentences.english: This corporation is as wealthy as many nations.

definition: Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
Han Dynasty term for the Roman Empire 羅馬帝國|罗马帝国[Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2]
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
